revised_title: The Effect of Liquid Air Exposure on the Tuberculosis Bacillus
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the effect of exposure to liquid air on the vitality and virulence of the tuberculosis bacillus. The results showed that exposure to liquid air had little effect on the bacillus's vitality but slightly modified its virulence. The study also found that the length of exposure did not impact the results and that immersion in liquid air did not produce different outcomes than simple exposure to its temperature.
